concepts.name: First Sino-Japanese War
concepts.description: A military conflict between China (Qing dynasty) and Japan (Empire of Japan) that lasted from 1894 to 1895.

concepts.name: Meiji Restoration
concepts.description: The Japanese modernization movement that led to the country's military reforms and ultimately contributed to its victory in the First Sino-Japanese War.

concepts.name: Empire of Japan
concepts.description: A historical nation-state that existed from the late 19th century to the mid-20th century.

concepts.name: Qing dynasty
concepts.description: The last imperial dynasty in China, which ruled from 1644 to 1912.

concepts.name: Korea
concepts.description: A country located on the Korean Peninsula in East Asia.

concepts.name: Liaodong Peninsula
concepts.description: A strategic region in northeastern China that was ceded to Japan as a result of the Treaty of Shimonoseki.

concepts.name: Taiwan
concepts.description: An island country located in East Asia.

concepts.name: Treaty of Shimonoseki
concepts.description: The treaty that ended the First Sino-Japanese War, granting Japan control of Taiwan, the Pescadores Islands, and the Liaodong Peninsula.

concepts.name: Admiral Itō Sukeyuki
concepts.description: The Japanese naval commander who played a key role in the First Sino-Japanese War, leading the Japanese navy to several victories against the Chinese fleet.
